gurmukhi: ਸਕ੍ਰ ਸੋ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੇ ਹੇਤ ਮਨੋ ਧਰਿ ਛਾਡਿ ਸਪੱਛ ੳੁਡੇ ਗਿਰ ਰਾੲੀ ||੧੭੫||
transliteration: Sakra So Juddh Ke Het Mano Dhar(i) Chhaad(i) Sapachchh Ude Gir Raaoo||175||
translation: It seems that in order to wage w war with Indra, the large winged mountain are flying from the earth.175.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਭ ਨਿਸੁੰਭ ਬਨਾੲਿ ਦਲੁ ਘੇਰਿ ਲੲਿਓ ਗਿਰ ਰਾਜ ||
transliteration: Sounbh Nisounbh Banaae Dal(u) Gher(i) Laio Gir Raaj||
translation: Gathering their forces Sumbh and Nisumbh have besieged the mountain.

gurmukhi: ਕਵਚ ਅੰਗ ਕਸਿ ਕੋਪ ਕਰਿ ੳੁਠੇ ਸਿੰਘ ਜਿੳੁ ਗਾਜ ||੧੭੬||
transliteration: Kavach An Kas(i) Kop Kar(i) Outhe Singh Jio Gadj||176||
translation: On their bodies they have tightened their armour and in rage they are roaring like lions.176.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਭ ਨਿਸੁੰਭ ਸੁ ਬੀਰ ਬਲੀ ਮਨ ਕੋਪ ਭਰੇ ਰਨ ਭੂਮਹਿ ਅਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Sounbh Nisounbh Su Boor Badoo Man Kop Bhare Ran Bhoomah(i) Aae||
translation: The mighty demons Sumbh and Nisumbh, filled with rage, have entered the battlefield.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖਨ ਮੈ ਸੁਭ ਅੰਗ ੳੁਤੰਗ ਤੁਰਾ ਕਰਿ ਤੇਜ ਧਰਾ ਪਰ ਧਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Dekhan Mai Soubh An Outan Turaa Kar(i) Tej Dharaa Par Dhaae||
translation: They, whose limas are winsome and lofty, they are driving their swift horses on the earth.

gurmukhi: ਧੂਰ ੳੁਡੀ ਤਬ ਤਾ ਛਿਨ ਮੈ ਤਿਹ ਕੇ ਕਨ ਤਾ ਪਗ ਸੋਂ ਲਪਟਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Dhoor Udoo Tab Taa Chin Mai Tih Ke Kan Taa Pag Son Laptaae||
translation: The dust rose at that time, whose particles are embracing their feet.

gurmukhi: ਠੳੁਰ ਅਡੀਠ ਕੇ ਜੈ ਕਰਬੇ ਕਹਿ ਤੇਜ ਮਨੋ ਮਨ ਸੀਖਨ ਅਾੲੇ ||੧੭੭||
transliteration: Thaur Adooth Ke Jai Karbe Kah(i0 Tej Mano Man Sookhan Aae||177||
translation: It seems that in order to conquer the invisible place, the mind in the form of particles hath come to learn about swiftness from the hooves.177.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਡ ਕਾਲਕਾ ਸ੍ਵਨ ਮੈ ਤਨਕ ਭਨਕ ਸੁਨਿ ਲੀਨ ||
transliteration: Channd Kaalkaa Sravan Mai Tanak Bhanak Soun(i) Loon||
translation: Chandi and Kali both heard slight rumour with their ears.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਰ ਸ੍ਰਿੰਗ ਗਿਰ ਰਾਜ ਤੇ ਮਹਾਂ ਕੁਲਾਹਲਿ ਕੀਨ ||੧੭੮||
transliteration: Outar Stiaag Gir Raaj Te Mahaan Kulaahal(i) Koon||178||
translation: They came down from the top of Sumeru and raised a great furore.178.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਵਤ ਦੇਖਿ ਕੈ ਚੰਡਿ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡਿ ਕੋ ਕੋਪ ਕਰਿਓ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਅਤਿ ਦਾਨੋ ||
transliteration: Aavat Dekh(i) Kai Channd(i) Prachanndd(i0 Ko Kop Kario Man Mai At(i0 Daano||
translation: Seeing the powerful Chandika coming towards him, the demon-king Sumbh became very furious.
